stock.model

Class StockImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • stock.model.StockImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IStock

    public class StockImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements IStock

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StockImpl(java.lang.String tickerSymbol, java.lang.Double valueOfPurchasedStock, java.time.LocalDateTime dateOfPurchase)
      This class represents a single stock.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Double getCostBasisOfStock()
      The total money invested in the stock (money spent buying it) is called the cost basis of the purchase in format $x.yz, ie, 2 digits after decimal.
      java.time.LocalDateTime getDateOfPurchase()
      Returns the date of the purchase in the LocalDateTime format of YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.
      java.lang.String getTickerSymbol()
      Returns the ticker symbol of the stock.
      java.lang.Double getValueByDate(java.time.LocalDateTime date)
      Returns the amount of money (that was invested) has grown (or shrunk) into as of the specified date.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the information about the stock in the format - "{ticker Symbol} bought at ${value at which stock was purchased} each on {date and time of the purchase}".

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • StockImpl

        public StockImpl(java.lang.String tickerSymbol,
                 java.lang.Double valueOfPurchasedStock,
                 java.time.LocalDateTime dateOfPurchase)
        This class represents a single stock. It holds its ticker symbol, value at which the stock was purchased and the date and time on which it was purchased. It communicates with the data source to fetch the value on specified date.
        Parameters:
        tickerSymbol - is unique symbol given to each company for trading purposes.
        valueOfPurchasedStock - the amount of money spent to buy this stock.
        dateOfPurchase - the date on which the stock was bought.

      • getCostBasisOfStock

        public java.lang.Double getCostBasisOfStock()
        Description copied from interface: IStock
        The total money invested in the stock (money spent buying it) is called the cost basis of the purchase in format $x.yz, ie, 2 digits after decimal.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the amount invested in the stock.

      • getValueByDate

        public java.lang.Double getValueByDate(java.time.LocalDateTime date)
        Description copied from interface: IStock
        Returns the amount of money (that was invested) has grown (or shrunk) into as of the specified date. It is the money that would be obtained if the stock is sold at particular date in format $x.yz, ie, 2 digits after decimal from a data source.
        Specified by:
        getValueByDate in interface IStock
        Parameters:
        date - at which the value of the stock is requested.
        Returns:
        the amount of money received if the stock is sold.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the information about the stock in the format - "{ticker Symbol} bought at ${value at which stock was purchased} each on {date and time of the purchase}".
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String of the stock.
